docs.snippet: Mexican officials have discovered hundreds of skeletal remains scattered on ranches in a stretch of towns along the U.S.-Mexico border as they carried out a wide search to locate missing people....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexican officials have discovered hundreds of skeletal remains scattered on ranches in a stretch of towns along the U.S.-Mexico border as they carried out a wide search to locate missing people.

headline.main: Mexico Finds Skeletal Remains Along US Border
headline.print_headline: Mexico Finds Skeletal Remains Along US Border

docs.snippet: Hundreds of records detailing sex-crime investigations involving U.S. military personnel stationed in Japan show most offenders were not incarcerated, suspects received light punishments after being accused of serious violations and victims increa...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of records detailing sex-crime investigations involving U.S. military personnel stationed in Japan show most offenders were not incarcerated, suspects received light punishments after being accused of serious violations and victims increasingly were wary of cooperating with investigators.

headline.main: AP Analysis of US Military Sex Crimes in Japan
headline.print_headline: AP Analysis of US Military Sex Crimes in Japan

docs.snippet: A Norwegian film that is part thriller, part spoof of the "Nordic Noir" genre, and a Chinese movie set in a massage clinic run by blind people and using some blind actors were the main offerings at the Berlin film festival on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Norwegian film that is part thriller, part spoof of the "Nordic Noir" genre, and a Chinese movie set in a massage clinic run by blind people and using some blind actors were the main offerings at the Berlin film festival on Monday.

headline.main: Norwegian Film Partly Spoofs 'Nordic Noir' at Berlin Fest
headline.print_headline: Norwegian Film Partly Spoofs 'Nordic Noir' at Berlin Fest

docs.snippet: A Mexican citizen who pleaded guilty to first-degree murder in the 2010 shooting death of a U.S. Border Patrol agent in a late-night gun battle near the Arizona border was sentenced on Monday to 30 years in federal prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Mexican citizen who pleaded guilty to first-degree murder in the 2010 shooting death of a U.S. Border Patrol agent in a late-night gun battle near the Arizona border was sentenced on Monday to 30 years in federal prison.

headline.main: Mexican Man Gets 30 Years in U.S. 'Fast and Furious' Case
headline.print_headline: Mexican Man Gets 30 Years in U.S. 'Fast and Furious' Case
